meanings.definition: A type of flower cluster with stalked flowers arranged along a central stem.
meanings.sent1: The racemes of colorful flowers brightened up the garden.
meanings.sent2: The florist arranged the racemes of roses in a beautiful bouquet.
meanings.sent3: The racemes of daisies danced in the breeze, making the garden look like a floral party.
meanings.sent4: Her smile bloomed like racemes of happiness, spreading joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The racemes of tulips stood tall and proud, like soldiers in a floral army.

meanings.definition: A type of inflorescence in which the flowers are arranged on a central axis.
meanings.sent1: The racemes of cherry blossoms lined the tree branches beautifully.
meanings.sent2: The gardener admired the racemes of lilacs blooming in perfect symmetry.
meanings.sent3: The racemes of sunflowers seemed to be competing in a floral race to the top.
meanings.sent4: Her hair cascaded down her back like racemes of flowing silk.
meanings.sent5: The racemes of orchids hung delicately, like chandeliers in a floral ballroom.
